meanings.definition: To release repressed emotions through cathartic expression.
meanings.sent1: She was abreacting her pent-up anger by screaming into a pillow.
meanings.sent2: He abreacted his sadness by painting a picture that expressed his emotions.
meanings.sent3: The play therapy session turned into a wild abreacting session of emotions.
meanings.sent4: Her tears were like a storm abreacting all the built-up tension within her.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to abreact all the hidden feelings she had bottled up.

meanings.definition: The process of reliving a traumatic experience in order to process and heal from it.
meanings.sent1: Her abreacting of the accident helped her come to terms with what happened.
meanings.sent2: The therapist guided her through the abreacting of the traumatic event.
meanings.sent3: The group therapy session turned into a collective abreacting of past traumas.
meanings.sent4: The abreacting of the memory was like opening an old wound to let it heal properly.
meanings.sent5: The abreacting process was emotionally exhausting but ultimately liberating.
